meanings.definition: A sudden charge out of a besieged place against the enemy.
meanings.sent1: During the battle, the brave soldiers made a daring sally from the fortress.
meanings.sent2: The surprise sally caught the enemy off guard.
meanings.sent3: The sally out of the castle was so unexpected that the enemy was left bewildered.
meanings.sent4: Her sally from the fort was like a lightning strike in the midst of the fight.
meanings.sent5: The sally out of the stronghold was a bold move that changed the course of the war.

meanings.sent1: Her sally at the party had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent2: He is known for his clever sallies during conversations.
meanings.sent3: The sally she made during the meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: His witty sally was like a breath of fresh air in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The sally she made was so funny that it became the talk of the town.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden charge or attack.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers sally forth bravely into battle.
meanings.sent2: She sallied out of the room in a fit of anger.
meanings.sent3: He sallied towards the opponent with determination.
meanings.sent4: The team sallied against the enemy with full force.
meanings.sent5: The knight sallied forth with his sword raised high.
